Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: flomap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located and nicely appointed. We found the reception staff to be very helpful. We did not have breakfast with our room so we did not eat at the hotel but did take advantage of the complimentary tea and coffee service. Our rooms were on the top floor facing the inner courtyard and quite peaceful--we had no street noise. We were a family of five--parents with three adult children and had two rooms with adequate space. The triple room had a toilet room and a bathing room which was helpful when the three were scrambling to get ready to go anywhere. The hotel is located in the Eixample area and we walked the entire city without a problem--we do like to walk. Others may prefer to take a cab or the subway to some areas. The beds are a little harder than the ones in many American hotels but I had no trouble sleeeping. We found the beds in most of the rooms in Spain to be a little harder and decided that it is preferred there. I did find this hotel to be a good choice--not super luxury but quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “All but one very important thing”
Reviews.Author: Toranika W
Reviews.Content: The hotel Dante was wonderful except for one very important thing. The bed was so hard and uncomfortable that I had back pains for two days of my vacation. It was very frustrating. Now everything else was great the service, the breakfast (was okay), the room was small but perfect for one person, and the hotel location was really close to center.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend the hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Tumerg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Dante for 6 nights during a one week visit to Barcelona. Our room was clean and comfortable, a little small though.. The reason I have chosen it was that Hotel Dante was one of the few hotels with breakfast included and free wifi, and located centrally. It was definitely worth the money spend, the Breakfast was good, the wifi so-so but OK and the location was also very suitable to walk to important touristic places. I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: zokra
Reviews.Content: I was in Barcellona in July 2011 with my husband and parents. It was a fantastic holiday and this is also partly due to the hotel we stayed in. On Hotel Dante I can say that:- - it is great value for money - it is very clean - it has excellent WIFI - it is located in a quite area but is within walking distance of the underground station which can take you EVERYWHERE - it is close to a very good supermarket - it provides a very good breakfast - I have slept peacefully and comfortably during all my stay I can't really comment about the staff because we didn't mingle much...we were practically out all day enjoying the different facets of bubbly Barcellona!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Barcelona- Dante”
Reviews.Author: RoastBeast
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in the Barcelona Dante - Best Western. It is a nice hotel and the staff was very helpful. Theiir English was not real good, but good enough to help us. It is about a mile walk to La Rambla and less than mile to catch the Hop-on-Hop- off bus whaic his a good way to get to know the city. The breakfast buffet was include and very good!!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: 353Mags
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at Hotel Dante and enjoyed our stay. Staff are friendly, attentive and helpful. The location is good, there is easy access to the train station and main areas of interest. Breakfast is delicious, it is self service with great selection of food both hot and cold. An ideal choice for a visit to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great staff, good value”
Reviews.Author: wimpdiver
Reviews.Content: Of the three BW I stayed at in Barcelona this one was head and shoulders above - although not very much more expensive! As I arrived a staff member noticed me lifting my suitcase to go up the three steps that one must use to enter the hotel and rushed to help me. This was a welcome introduction to the EXCELLENT service standard of the hotel. Everyone was amazingly helpful and friendly from front desk staff to the room maids! Rooms were well appointed, clean and comfortable. I was a little worried about noise as I was right across from to the elevator - but never heard a sound from there as there were double doors into the room, nor was street noise a problem most of the time as I was high and the windows were double paned. The one problem, though, was the VERY thin walls. I could hear a loud phone conversation from the room next door and on two other nights some "ahem" very personal noises. There is a supermarket one minute walk as well as an all you can eat buffet called Freeway next door (I didn't eat there but had a look and they had an amazing variety of fish and other goodies some cooked to order) which is quite inexpensive (by local standards). It is also a 5 15 minute walk from 2 Micheal starred restaurants - where I had wonderful meals. There are buses within a block of the hotel and if you have a T10 ticket you could take it to the train station and then use it again on the bus 44 (I think) - which doesn't count as another journey if it's within 1'15" of first use:)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosomoso
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a modern clean and well managed enterprise. We had a pleasant room which was large and well appointed, and we had a good nights sleep in comfortable beds. You are close to the Ramblas, restaurants and bars. Breakfast was excelllent with hot and cold items.

Reviews.Title: “While in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Texan56
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a few days in Barcelona and were fortunate enough to find a great hotel. The Dante is within walking distance of the Ramblas and a couple of subway stations. The room was great and the service was excellent. People were friendly and very helpful when it came to getting directions and tips of city tours. We will definetly stay there in our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Premier Dante, Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Barc2011
Reviews.Content: On a trip in January, 2011 my wife and I stayed there prior to going on a cruise. The facility was clean, modern, reasonably priced, accessible within a short walking distance to the main shopping area, safe, close to good restaurants, had good wi-fi access, and the staff was terrific. Juan Nadal and Margarita Ferret were especially helpful and proficient in English. Overall, the hotel was a star above Best Westerns in the USA we have stayed in, and should we return to Barcelona we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: 4apa
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Location is good. It doesn`t take long time to go in the center of barcelona, about 15 minutes by walk to the place Catalonia or Sants railway station. Room is big, clear and clean. Bed is comfortable, but pillow is small, i used two. Bathroom was with bath and shower. Staff is helpful and professional. Breakfast is wonderful with wide range of meals. Good choice in the Barcelone for its value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & great value”
Reviews.Author: EddieGCG
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this Best Western Hotel in Barcelona in December 2011. The hotel staff were very helpful in supplying infomation on the city and area. The whole of the hotel was spotlessly clean and the rooms came with all the little extras plus more that you would normally associate with 5 star hotels such as bathrobes, toothbrushes as well as all the soaps lotions combs shoe shines etc etc. Free WiFi was available in your room and for those without a laptop there was one availble to use in the reception area. Breakfast was more than sufficient to carry you through the day to the evening meal. During our stay the breakfast room on the first floor was being renovated and the breakfast was served on the ground floor in a smaller bar. The hotel is only 5 / 10 minute walk from Las Rambles where you can catch the Hop on Hop off tourist bus to see all the tourist attractions. It was also only a 2/ 3 minute walk to many of the cities gay bars. Without a doubt when we next go to Barcelona we will again stay in Best Western Hotel Dante.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Break”
Reviews.Author: Hayeswater27
Reviews.Content: A disappointing stay. Not sure how it gets a 4 star rating. Not that central (despite the claims) but OK. No leisure facilities whilst the bar area doubles up as the breakfast room with breakfast served on the bar. Surprised there are no provisions for an evening meal other than room service. Room fine but got no sleep with the street noise. Staff very 'hit and miss'; some very helpful ... some off-handed. Wi fi a real plus but missed tea / coffee facilities in the room; particularly as ordering anything from room service was a complete nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: BibigulDoha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the Eixample district. Its walking distance from Metro stations, center of city and the main attraction Sagrada Familia. There is a super market almost next door which was great to replenish our water and other needs. The ATM's are closeby, another plus point. The room was clean, with an extra sofa bed for our teenage son. He was very happy and comfortable in his bed as were we. The pillows were excellent as we usually have problems with finding the right ones. Would have loved to have a bidet in the bathroom. As the other Best Western hotels that we stayed in had them. The staff were extremely helpful in every way possible. Giving exact, precise directions to various locations, booking further hotels for onward journey, booking tickets on the phone for Alhambra and also airline tickets online. We stayed 3 nights first time and left luggage with them to visit Granada and Seville and then stayed 1 night on the way out. Loved the variety of breakfast served. Special thanks to all the staff for making our stay enjoyable and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a nice location.”
Reviews.Author: Eimear2318
Reviews.Content: This hotel is slightly off the main tourist drag but that was excellent for us but there is a bank, supermarket and chemist close by. The staff were super and the breakfast buffet very extensive. The most expensive wine they sold was €13, very good value in comparison to UK hotels and it was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rather be sitting on a beach
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed in in November 2011 for 4 nights, we had 8 rooms. The hotel is well located, the staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, comfortable and totally acceptable. Breakfast is buffet style with sufficient choice. The barman mixes a great Sangria, give it a try. Overall, very happy with hotel and I can reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “clean and good value...”
Reviews.Author: DSteveCA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night prior to boarding our cruise ship. We called from the airport to see if the hotel offered shuttle service to/from the airport. It doesn't. Same thing for shuttle service to the cruise ship terminal. The staff advised us to take the Aero bus from the airport and to walk the 10 blocks from the University Plaza bus stop. Next time we will take a taxi rather than walk with luggage. The room was clean and comfortable. The room was located on the 7th floor and overlooked a construction site -- which, fortunately, did not generate any noise during our stay. The front desk staff spoke good English and were helpful in advising us on where to eat locally. We didn't eat at the hotel, although a restaurant is available on-site.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: nbl50
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant, quiet, quality hotel. 1.3km from centre and without pool/spa reduces stars from 5 to 4. Very clean, with experienced, low key professional staff. Buffet breakfast superb.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: dorsNorthEast
Reviews.Content: have just had a three night stay and found everything to be fine, hotel is very clean with nice furnishings comfortable beds and friendly and helpful staff. its a quiet hotel and if we had one dissapointment it would have been nice to be able to have a nightcap when we came in at night but the small bar closed before 11pm, as it wasn't near any rooms i think this could have been extended slightly, but all in all we had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: marcs1Nyc_Ny
Reviews.Content: Checked in on a October Sunday morning after a cruise and our room was ready at 0930 hrs. Staff at the front desk were fluent in English and were very helpful. The room (202) was in front of one of the two elevators but we never heard a sound. The room has a spacious bathroom to your left as you enter. It contained all the amenities one could want. Further down a small foyer is the bedroom with an in-room safe and more than adequate closet space. The television received many channels with three in English. The beds and bedding were comfortable. Air-conditioning worked fine. The window looked out on the Calle Mallorca. The street was quiet as it was Sunday when most businesses are closed. But there are restaurants very close to the hotel which appeared to be doing good business. The hotel is about six streets from a stop on the Blue Line of the Hop-On, Hop-Off tourist bus and slightly more than that distance from a stop on the Red Line. We did not have the breakfast buffet as we checked out of the hotel before the buffet opened.

Reviews.Title: “Good in every way”
Reviews.Author: carolina46
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the hotel, this time for two weeks on business. The room had a private sun terrace with table and chairs and two sun loungers, perfect for in-room dinners, and the bathroom was equipped with a large jacuzzi. The king size bed is enormous, and there were two wardrobes in the room. The breakfast buffet is wonderful - with everything you could wish for - yogurt, cereal, cheese, hams and meats, fruit, salad and a choice of hot food including bacon, scrambled eggs, etc with a range of breads, coffee, tea and hot chocolate. I also used the laundry and dry cleaning service a lot during my stay - very quick and efficient, and not so expensive. Everything was immaculately clean. The neighbourhood is very safe, with supermarkets, fruit shops etc within a few yards and although it is on a main street, the room was totally quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel for short break”
Reviews.Author: GalacticoandMoon
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel with friendly staff in a good location. A 15-20 minute walk to Las Ramblas. Room was clean and tidy. Breakfast adequate with continental selection available. Reception staff organised tickets for an FC Barcelona match at the Camp Nou with transfers to and from the stadium. Only negative was that a room service order of tea took more than an hour to be delivered.

Reviews.Title: “5 * Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: mnm2010_10
Reviews.Content: First impressions are so important and from arrival to departure the staff working at reception couldn't have been more helpful, friendly or welcoming..for this alone I would recommend staying here. We were definitely made feel like more than just a credit card no.!! On check-in it was hotel policy to provide guests, in my case tourist, with an awareness sheet of things to look-out for during the stay apart from the obvious tourist attractions...It's the little things that make the difference! The gentlemen at reception were courteous and helpful when there were complications with printing boarding passes for departure flights. The location was fine with shopping and dining areas within walking distance and yet far enough away from the crowded tourist attractions. The rooms were comfortable..all in all a pleasant stay was had!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Kavzchat
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend the Best Western Dante as a great place to stay-- large rooms, very comfortable, great break fast, very helpful staff (they helped us book our bus tours, flamenco dance concerts etc at very reasonable rates), great breakfast, good location. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “American standards in SpAin great value”
Reviews.Author: terrywelsh
Reviews.Content: Metro station closest to hotel is Hosptital zone. Easy walk to sagrada familia and Las Ramblas. FRee morning breakfast buffet . Slighty away from all the tourist places and all the noise. Staff was bilingual and helpful. Spent 9 days in Barcelona. At this hotel. An oasis of safety and calm

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms, good breakfast, but loud A/C and a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: glebita
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days in a very large room on the seventh floor with huge balcony and an office with laptop and Nespresso machine. It was a very relaxing hotel to come back to after sightseeing and the breakfast buffet was great every morning. Only complaint was the A/C was too loud to leave on at night while sleeping. Also, for the most part, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Except for when we checked in very early after departing from a cruise, our room was not yet ready and we had to wait a few hours before it was ready. They offered to hold all our luggage, which was great, but wouldn't let us take part in the breakfast. For the money we were paying for a fairly long stay, we thought they could've thrown in breakfast. Other than this minor thing, our stay in Barcelona was good.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and very helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: larroo011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western Dante after our Mediteranean cruise. Hotel was clean, well located and the staff was very helpfull. No hesitation to recomend it. Breakfast was good, but not extravagant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: maprghp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a three block walk to the nearest metro station (called Hospital Clinic) or about a 15 minute walk which is practically perfect. You're not swamped in the tourist trap areas, but it was an easy walk to restaurants and shops. There's also a small supermarket nearby which was great for a late night chocolate run to satisfy late night cravings! Our hotel room overlooked the main road and while not the most picturesque view, the traffic wasn't too loud. (Although perhaps because we were on the fourth floor!) The air conditioning certainly took care of any noise on the street, as it rattled and whirred its way through the night. Very effective but probably too loud if you're sensitive to noise while sleeping. The room itself was of a decent size for two people and our room was always made up every day to a very high standard. Although a double bed was requested and we found ourselves with two singles put together, the arrangement was still fine. However even for a person that likes a hard mattress, I would comment the beds were quite hard and it was considered for us the worst aspect of the room. The bathroom was spacious and had been finished to a lovely standard in accordance with the rest of the hotel. Even the room service food was of a reasonable price and tasted as good as any restaurant food! Breakfast during the week is from 7.30am - 10.30am and on the weekend it's extended to 11am. An array of mostly continental food and a few cooked items was laid out every morning as well as fresh juices, tea and coffee. It definitely helped us stoke up for the rest of the day and was well worth paying the extra money to have breakfast included. The hotel staff speak excellent English and are very friendly. They helped us with many things such as on our first night they recommended a restaurant, booked us a place there and marked it for us on a map. They also stored our luggage, ordered us a taxi and took our bags to the taxi on our final day. They also provide you with a wifi username and password when you check in as there is free wifi throughout the hotel and also a handout on the best ways to stay safe when walking around barcelona. Extremely helpful as it makes you aware of the tricks others have suffered from which could find you out of pocket afterwards! The Dante Hotel is great for that extended weekend getaway in terms of location and the hotel itself. We had no problem paying the price we did for our stay although perhaps it could be considered expensive at approximately £500 for four nights in what is considered the off peak season in the summer month of July . It was also before the summer holidays in the UK had even started which presumably meant prices would look to rise further. For a couple in their mid twenties the price may seem very reasonable, however for us having just finished our A levels it seemed a bit steep. Once we'd divided the cost by two however and had had our Barcelona getaway, it seemed like a good price to pay. Knowing we could return home every evening after having done a lot of walking and experiencing some amazing sites, to a comfortable, quiet and peaceful place was extremely inviting. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and won’t forget how the staff and hotel made our journey to Barcelona, one never to forget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: Mailmark1
Reviews.Content: An excellent quiet location if you are there for the sights and not the raucous night sounds of Barcelona. Well away from Las Ramblas, but easy to get to on the Metro. The hotel staff are very friendly, the breakfast is very good with a large choice of hot and cold options, though hot mixed vegetables as a choice with Bacon didn’t really appeal to us. There are cold meats and cheeses, croissants, breads and plenty of fruit. You can even order fresh tea delivered to your room each day free of charge. The hotel does not have a restaurant but does have a bar that offers snacks. However there are hundreds of local places to eat but remember that if it’s a ‘proper’ restaurant that you want they don’t tend to open before 8 – 8.30 in the evening. All the major ‘Gaudi’ sites are easy to reach some just a few blocks away from the hotel. The others are again very easy to reach using the Metro. TIP: If you go to Parc Guell on the Metro go to the VALLCARCA Station and then head up BAIXIDA De La Gloria. It is Steep but it has lots of outdoor Escalators! This is brilliant as it takes you into the top of the parc and from there you can meander down to the sites. If you go via the LESSEPS Station you will have a long walk and its all uphill.... no escalators. We had a great stay and this was a great Hotel to return to each day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: jimjam76
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights' late June as part of a family holiday meeting relative's from Australia in Spain and choosing Barcelona as a start point . Hotel were very accommodating with all request's including early check-in for the Aussie contingent. Staff were very friendly and helpful with a good knowledge of the city and the rooms were comfortable and a good size for a European city center hotel . It is a little way from Las Ramblas but you can walk it in around 20-30 mins and its only a few blocks until your there.All rooms have flat screens and free WiFi and the breakfast is good with varied choices. We didn't eat any other meals in the hotel but there is a small bar which serves meals and a great restaurant just across the road called ' El Puchero de Baralantra ' which serves fantastic food at fair prices ! All in all a very comfortable stay in Barca! Great staff and a decent location , not such a busy area but right near everything there is to see in Barcelona . Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Cathy43081
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just OK. The staff were friendly and helpful but the location as a tourist hotel was a little out of the way. I was there with my teenage daughter who would have liked to be a bit nearer the centre, especially in the evening. Breakfast looked better that it tasted, all was a little bland. Free and fast internet access which is always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: rubywren
Reviews.Content: We. loved this hotel . It was in a lovely location - just a short walk fom La Ramblas. The room was very comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Woud definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay on a city trip”
Reviews.Author: RickTizzy
Reviews.Content: Even the price was good, altho parking for 25euro a day was a little steep, overall excellent value for money at 130euro a night. Breakfast is included and a great breakfast it is too. Location is also perfect, only 5 blocks away from Casa Battlo and Placa de Catalunya. Room is classy and clean and a good size with plenty of space to unpack all your stuff and still be able to dance a jig on your luck at finding this place. Great bathroom and shower with plenty waterpressure (at least in the evening, morning was a little less pressure but that's to be expected I guess). Staff also very helpfull and willing to provide good tips on places to eat, getting tickets and where to go for the good stuff. Well recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Dante Delivered a Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: AdventureLass
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several nights during the week between Christmas and New Years, 2010. The hotel itself was clean, my room very clean and quiet, and larger than most European hotels. The bed was comfortable, and the washroom adequate. Even though my room was next to the elevator, I never heard elevator noise or noise from other guests. I cannot speak for rooms at the front of the hotel, or along the street, as my room was at the back of the hotel. The hotel lobby area has a small bar and an area for seating - some guests were playing cards, others having a glass of wine, which I did while writing postcards. The breakfast was varied and plentiful - many meats, cheeses, fruits, and a wide variet of items to choose from, with an attentive staff available if need be. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful including helping to provide directions, helping to read maps, and assistance with calling for a taxi that was reliable and wouldn't scam me! The location of the hotel is roughly 7 block to the Metro and tourist buses, about 2 blocks to an internet cafe with very reasonable rates, which was recommended by the staff, and close to several restaurants and pubs. There is a grocery store next door. The neighborhood felt safe at all times. I would definately stay here again. I was not at all disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel -we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: HollyDays45
Reviews.Content: We stopped at this hotel for three nights to celebrate my sister -in -law's birthday and having mentioned this when booking we were greeted with a bottle of bubbly and basket of fruit in our room - a nice touch by the management.Thanks! Rooms There were three of us in a double room and there was more than enough space -Rooms were vey clean ,comfortable and well furnished with dressing gowns in the bathroom too. There was a problem with lack of water across the whole hotel on our first night but this was fixed and there were no more problems. Breakfast Plenty of choice for breakfast from cereals to cheeses, meats ,yoghurts,fruit toast and pastries to cooked sausage ,scambled eggs etc .Delicious and very fresh. Location This hotel is only a few blocks from Passieg de Gracia and we enjoyed a leisurely stroll down to Placa de Catalunya and onto La Rambla .The hotel was on a road but it seemed to be quite a quiet location. Staff The hotel staff were very helpful booking tickets for us,booking taxis etc and nothing was too much trouble . Attractions The hop off -hop -on buses are very good value .It is worth getting a 2 day pass if you are in Barcelona for a few days. Parc Guiell was very impressive and worth hopping off the bus for as was the spanish village ( 8 euros in and a real bargain!);The Gothic quarter is wonderful with narrow streets , a wonderful cathedral and had some very good street entertainers when we there too from classical musicians to street dancers. All in all a wonderful stay in a wonderful city with great staff in a great hotel We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Greaty Hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: paulpip
Reviews.Content: Booked direct with Best Western, and stayed 3 nights last week, the hotel is well situated only 5 blocks from rambles, a good thing as the area around the hotel is quiet on an evenig yet there are plenty of bars and restaurants in easy walking distance....

Reviews.Title: “Good Best Western again”
Reviews.Author: skyeyed
Reviews.Content: We've been really impressed with the Best Western chain around Europe especially the premier range. Hotel Dante followed the same theme. The pointers I can extend to fellow travellers are; - The beds are a little hard. Good for some not for others - The walls are a little thin unfortunately, could hear discussions next door - Staff appear not to understand the Best Western loyalty program for Platinum members which states "Complimentary room upgrades, early check-in and late check-out privileges, upon availability" - It is a fair walk from Les Rambles, say about a good 10 min quick walk. However its positioned in a real good neighbourhood so really no problems. 5 mins to the nearest metro. Expect a little walking to enjoy this hotel. - The breakfast is excellent. Definitely add that to the morning - Good value, clean & tight - Great staff, professional 4 star but relaxed enough if you know what I mean. Good experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ShalomReport
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Best Western Hotels over the years for business and pleasure and this Best Western hotel is one of the best I stayed so far. The hotel is located close to most tourist attractions, great restaurants and cafes in a quiet and safe neighbourhood of Barcelona. The staff which speaks good English is very friendly and helpful in organizing your stay in Barcelona. The breakfast buffet is very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice distance from the Rambla”
Reviews.Author: Badutten
Reviews.Content: Had a suite on the 7. floor with a very nice terrace and sunny weather :-) Room, service, breakfast was all above average and the location 5 minutes away from the upper Rambla was vey good. Internet worked perfect and a nice gesture with a bootle of Cava as welcome was a nice touch :-) All in all a pleasant hotels with very nice and helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Inbedralvi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. Overall, we are very satisfied about our stay at Hotel Dante: - breakfast: extended buffet - spacy, clean rooms - friendly staff - good service Good location, close to the Rambla.

Reviews.Title: “Shame about the location”
Reviews.Author: oldwaterdog
Reviews.Content: I have always been a fan of Best Western as it is normally reliable and good value. This Hotel was the first BW that did not supply tea/coffee making facilities in the room and that was a dissapointment. They served a good selection at breakfast, but hot dishes were put out with no means of keeping them hot, we therefore had cold eggs, cold bacon and cold sausage, so simple to put right but no -one bothered. There was free Wi-fi, but use of the computer was charged, another BW first, again dissapointing. The worst thing was the location. 10 minutes walk from the nearest Metro, and 7 blocks from the top of the Ramblas, hardly ideal for seeing the sights. That said the room were small but very clean and comfortable and nights were quiet. The staff extremely friendly and helpfull

Reviews.Title: “The best of the Best Western”
Reviews.Author: Octobernew
Reviews.Content: Dante is the best of all Best Western we've ever been! Very clean, light and smells nice. But the most impressive is breakfast! You can find everything you like: different kind of cheese, sausages, fish, vegetables and fruits, baked goods....... I like everything, especially good service (and breakfast) for such a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: MXLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights to celebrate my partner's birthday. Chose this hotel as the price was good and the hotel seemed well located on maps. I was very impressed by the entire stay. The staff were extremely efficient, helpful and friendly. The room was comfortable and of a good size for an urban European hotel. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and tasty. The area around the hotel was good. It's a 5-10 minute walk to the nearest metro station but Barcelona is an excellent city to walk around so we went on foot to Sagrada Familia, Las Ramblas etc. In the streets immediately around the hotel are plenty of restaurants and bars, ranging from small local joints to trendy design bars (and lots in between). The area felt safe day and night. I didn't try the WiFi as we were on vacation, and we didn't use the bar or restaurant (we considered having a drink one evening before going out but the bar was empty so felt a bit soulless). I would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: felicarrillo
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at this hotel and although rooms are small, they are just enough if you are going to be out walking around Barcelona all day. Don't expect this to be a hotel to stay in the room and have fun, instead make sure that you have your b/fast included so you can eat well and then go out to see the marvelous city Barcelona is. Close to the Metro station (5 blocks), to Rambla Catalunya and to nice restaurants you will be in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Everything, Through and Through”
Reviews.Author: Toronto84
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very friendly and informative with one staffer we saw only once being very down to earth and suggestive of off the path venues that were safe and fun for tourists (we're still here, obviously!). The dining area was cozy and our server for two visits, Paolo, was more amazing than the English language can describe. He should be promoted and given a pay raise every which way. The rooms were smaller than most North American rooms but there was no lying on the reservations and our research to European hotels, esp. Barcelona. Plenty of light and well cleaned rooms were given and we had breakfast included (also very well done and stocked). Breakfast was better earlier in the morning as closer to the end time they stopped restocking most food. The beds were nice however the pillows were single pieces spanning the width of the bed. It was very awkward and made us overheat more than expected. One of the safes weren't functioning very well but a small fist to the side set the locking mechanism in place properly. Cultural downtown core and major transit routes were all within 1-3 blocks distance and without much of the heavy traffic closer to the core (Passeig de Gracia and La Rambla).

Reviews.Title: “Seriously?”
Reviews.Author: Memfan
Reviews.Content: What an awful hotel! Let me start with my bias. We booked two separate rooms. We get there, and they've given us one. After arguing with us over what we booked (they said that we did not book adjoining rooms), and after they were faxed a receipt, they acknowledged that their records had all along shown that we booked "adjoining" rooms. However, they then argued over what was meant by "adjoining." The manager then had the gall to pretend that he couldn't follow us in English. However, my friend and I are both fluent in Spanish. The manager acknowledged that the "adjoining rooms" option cost more than the single room option, but actually claim that the posted description meant that we were seeking to book a single room with an adjoining door! "Why would anyone pay extra just to have an extra locked door?" We soon got to the bottom of this scam when a sympathetic employee explained to us out of the manager and front desk guy's earshot that Hotel Dante manager does this intentionally. They collect the higher rate for adjoining rooms from unsuspecting American guests, put them in one room, and wait for the complaint. They then pretend such confusion has never before happened, and explain to the gringo that only adjoining room was booked. If there's too much fuss, they pretend they can't follow in English, and count on the traveler to give up the fight after a long international flight (according to the staffer, the no English thing has failed them before, but they keep trying it anyways). They then turn around and rent the actual adjoining rooms to Spainards, getting double premiums for the rooms. The disenchanted staffer pointed out that everyone seems to miss that they don't even get the room they supposedly paid for, as the gringos are never put in one the rooms that could adjoin (as there would be no way to then collect a premium for actually renting those rooms as adjoining rooms to Spaniards). He told us that someone had rattled them before by insisting on a room with the extra door, and that we should do the same. Following his advice, we keyed in on the fact that the room they gave us didn't actually have an extra door, and we forced them to move us to a adjoining room with a locked extra door. By doing this, we cost them the extra premium, but the manager and front desk manager were extremely nasty to us after that. The front desk guy even gave us directions after that, that if followed, would have made us miss the very event for which we came to Barcelona. Good thing we no longer trusted him. But as for the hotel itself, the location is pretty bad. It's far better to stay closer to downtown. The staff is bumbling in either English or Spanish. The rooms are tiniest I have experienced anywhere, and I've been to 40+ countries. The air conditioner didn't work half the time, and the room was burning hot. The wifi never gave us a usable signal, and we had to resort to internet cafes. The maids though, were very friendly, and tanks to being near nowhere, it was quiet. However, I've stayed at other hotels in Barcelona, and is the by far the worst. There are much better options closer to downtown for the same price. After this and another experience in the U.S., I've learned to not trust the Best Western name. You simply never know what you're going to get as each hotel is individually owned, and there is no standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaVancouver
Reviews.Content: I initially booked this hotel (3 nights pre cruise) because it was one at which I could use my aeroplan points. It far surpassed my expectations both in accomodations and service. The staff from the front desk to housekeeping were helpful and friendly. The room was immaculate, linens chged daily and the robes hanging in the bathroom were a very nice touch. There was a large variety of breakfast items much like you would find on a cruise ship. The location was not in the hub of things but transit was good and most people were happy to tell you how to get to the major attractions. For us, it was kind of nice to get out of the tourist area at night time. It would have been nice to have a few more english speaking channels on the tv but for the time spent in the room it was not a serious issue. And yes I would stay there again and again and again.....etc We stayed at the BW 54, 2 days post cruise which I will review separately.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: EnglishManinSD
Reviews.Content: The Good - Staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was plentiful. Hotel room was very clean and the bed was comfortable with a The bad - Internet connection was extreeeemly slow and often timed out, gave up on checking emails on the computer and relied on my blackberry, not so good when trying to type long emails. A little removed from la rambla but nothing a brisk walk cant cure ( to burn off those extra calories you eat at dinner) The Ugly - the one night we dined in the bar, the waiter was not only serving drinks and food, he was also prepping it and cooking it too. Two on reception and one in the bar, yet neither offered help. Really understaffed and I saw at least three tables walk out in the two hours or so we were in there. He missed the first course I ordered but probably due to the fact he was trying to wait on and cook for 6 tables and then deliver room service. The food was not that tasty and was very small in portion. Also we were told that the fridge was broken so no tomato and no egg...but still had cool crisp lettuce...hmmm.

Reviews.Title: “amazing value for great room...”
Reviews.Author: Flipje67
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several BCN hotels in recent years on business or leisure trips to the city, and I have to say for price/quality relationship and location this has to be my favourite to which I would return. I had a huge room on the 7th floor (reception guy said it was one of the best in the hotel - lucky me!) with a balcony (two sun loungers, table and chairs and a bit of a view of the rooftops). Nespresso machine, Jacuzzi bath, separate walk-in shower. Good airco. Free WIFI (there was also a laptop already in the room if I hadn't had my own). For the rate I paid I think I most definitely lucked out on the room. Great location - easily walkable to Universitat metro station and a bit further to Plaça Catalunya. Breakfast buffet pretty extensive including hot and cold selections. Good coffee. Staff on check in and check out were very pleasant and efficient. Taxi from airport was 20 Eur (without tip) - but on the way back I took the bus from Plaça Catalunya for 5 Eur - also very easy if you have light luggage (or wheels!).

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Dante”
Reviews.Author: HenrikC2
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean room, possibility for parking, breakfast included which is rare find in BCN. Centrally located close to the bar area and in walking distance from the Gothic area.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed 3 times and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Des_Gruntled
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three times now, twice in the inside facing rooms (single rooms) and once on the sixth floor in a double room. The inside rooms do not have a view except of other rooms - you can always close the curtains. As a busness traveller I'm not there during the day so I don't care about the view. The rooms have always been clean and are well serviced. Make sure you have the breakfast which is excellent. The restaurant has a limited but reasonably priced menu. The bar isn't extensively stocked but the bottles of Voll Dam beer are worth a try. There are lots of small restaurants nearby some of which are on the pricey side for what they are. There is an English pub called the Philharmonic two blocks away which shows UK football. Three blocks away is Provenca station from where you can take a train to Playa de Catalunya if you don't want to walk. The only bugbears I have with this otherwise excellent hotel are 1. Not enough English speaking TV channels (only 2 and they're BBC World(News) and an American news channel). 2. The free WiFi is not reliable. Tip - sit in the restaurant near reception for the best signal and they can also reboot the router from reception if it all goes wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, older hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctorjessie
Reviews.Content: The photos on the web site show a nicer hotel than I recall. These may be rooms that were newer/recently remodeled. The room we stayed in was comfortable and of good size with a small seating area. The breakfast buffet was very good with tasty meats, cheeses and pastries. What made the hotel so wonderful was the friendly, helpful staff. It was close to many of the attractions and it was very easy to find a bus, taxi, or metro stop. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Dante and found the location, staff and room excellent.”
Reviews.Author: KatyHopeIsland
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were attentive and helpful, the room was comfortable, the included buffet breakfast was excellent, the location was quiet and yet close enough to walk to tourist sites. We did not suffer from street or other room noise, the location is safe and overall, we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “More than average”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: Its a small hotel ,clean with very small rooms looks very new and well mantained biggest con is the fact that is around 10 blocks from plaza cataluña anyway the area of the hotel is safe and distance anyway is easily walkable liked the breakfast buffet which was included in our rate few good restaurants around or atractions so be prepare to walk or taxi

Reviews.Title: “A Clean and Comfortable Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: CruisingFamily3
Reviews.Content: Prior to our 7/19 cruise, my husband and 11 year old son stayed three nights at the Dante Hotel. After positive experiences at Best Western Hotels in Rome, Italy last year and Hamburg, Germany in 2005, we decided to stay at Best Western in Barcelona. Our room was a triple with large twin beds and a comfortable sofa bed. We also had a balcony located in a quiet court yard. The bathroom was modern and the room was cleaned each morning immaculately. Included with our room price was a sufficient buffet breakfast in a large room (I'm hooked on the coffee) with a wide selection of foods to satisfy everyone's taste. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was pleasurable; especially Carmen Martin and Jacinto. After our cruise on 7/26, we stayed an additional three nights. We would not hesitate to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff a bit indifferent”
Reviews.Author: tazcaly
Reviews.Content: This is a small but adequate hotel near enough to most Barcelona attractions. The price was good for a big city but beware that if breakfast is NOT included in your hotel price it is outrageously priced (17 euros per person). Nowhere in the breakfast room did it tell us that price. Rooms are small but nicely appointed and have higher quality amenities than most Best Westerns. Although there was no coffee maker in the room, room service delivers coffee and tea at no charge. The hotel has a small restaurant (separate from the breakfast room) that was a bit more reasonable for lunch or dinner but was no great shakes. My major complaint was with the staff. They could not answer basic questions about where to find travel necessities. Also pickpockets are notorious in the area and after my husband was hit by one (they didn't get anything but they spill some crap on you that looks like vomit or bird doo and then offer to help you clean it off as they pick your pockets) the hotel staff gave us a safety sheet that warned of this. When he asked why we didn't get it at check in the clerk said the manager didn't want to 'scare' business people by giving it out during the week so they only give it on weekends. There is free internet and it worked well but the staff had only one converter plug and it was checked out to another guest for an extended period of days. The staff couldn't tell us where to buy one.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: krawimi
Reviews.Content: The hotel was decent and clean. My family had 2 rooms. Both were small, although we saw other rooms that looked more normal size. One of our bathrooms was tiny. Actually, the word "tiny" is inadequate. The shower was good. We paid around 85 euros per night per room. Breakfast was included. I think for that price, the hotel was appropriate or even a good deal given the location. The lobby cafe was really bad, but the breakfast was good for what it was - not gourmet, but good selection and very reasonable quality for an included hotel breakfast. All in all, I would not stop a friend from staying at Hotel Dante assuming he or she got a good price. But I probably wouldn't push it as a luxury experience either - simply a fair deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Dante”
Reviews.Author: LINCSLADDIE
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona having stayed at the Hotel Dante. I would just like to say what an excellent Hotel it was. Everywhere was spotlessly clean and all the staff were most helpful. Nothing was too much trouble for them. We had adjoining rooms 412 and 413 and they were perhaps the best we have ever stayed in. We cannot comment on the restaurant as we always ate out. Breakfast in the Hotel was very good with plenty of options and was constantly replenished. The Dante is in a nice quiet area. The only negative side to the Hotel is that it is nearly 5 blocks (20 minutes steady walk) to the nearest Metro station (Diagonal). Apart from this though I would recommend Hotel Dante to anyone visiting this great City.

Reviews.Title: “Good No Nonsense Hotel”
Reviews.Author: passiontravel9
Reviews.Content: Hotel Dante was an excellent 4 star no nonsense hotel, in the sense it just delivered what it promised. Good location not very far from main attractions in Barcelona and also near the famous Red Bus lines which are really good to see the city as such.The brekfast was excellent and i really stayed at a 4 star hotel after a very long time but to tell you the truth this hotel did not make me feel even for a moment that i should have stuck to my luxury selections.The bed was extremely comfortable and the morning breakfast was excellent. The tall gentleman at the reception and the blond lady were specially very good as were most of the other staff at the hotel.Would like to look at other best western properties in the future after my experience at this hotel.If i had to have a negative for this hotel was that this hotel is not very near a metro station but thats ok as its not very far too.Barcelona in general was a great city and this hotel was a real value pick.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: edthered7
Reviews.Content: given a room on top floor really comfortable massive bed, seperate office ,bathroom nice and big, wi fi access,music,plasma tv, mini bar and fresh fruit, excellent service. great location will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshirebred
Reviews.Content: visited for a short break. Had been worried about general standard of hotels in Barcelona after reading other reviews for many of hotels advertised. Hotel Dante is modern and well furnished. The whole hotel was exceptionally clean with good room service. Staff were polite and helpful when aproached for information. Breakfast was self service buffet with wide range of good quality items including champagne. All items constantly replenished.Very little outside noise. Walls were quite thin and only noise came from other guests when shouting, singinging or moving about. Bedrooms were not the biggest but were certainly adequate,comfortable and well appointed. Location is about 15 miniutes walk from Placa Catalunya and Ramblas. Well served with restaurants and bars nearby. This hotel was a good base fro Barcelona and made for a pleasant and stressfree base. Would certainly use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littletraveller104
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 5 days in Barcelona and a very pleasant stay at the Hotel Dante. Staff were very friendly, rooms were nicely decorated, bathroom looked great and it was all kept very clean. Tea/coffee making facilities were not available in the room, but were free via room service 24/7. Breakfast was lovely with a great choice - although I didn't eat the cooked so can't comment on that. Great selection of everything else though. We regularly used the Metro to get about - very easy and cheap. The closest Metro station we used was Hospital Clinic and was about 5-10 minute walk away. The only downside was that the internal walls were pretty thin and not great on soundproofing - but it was all pretty quiet at night - so it would not deter me from returning. We did also get natural daylight from the window - unlike some other guests that have posted a comment on here! Well, I would go back....great location, clean, friendly staff, good price! I booked via [--] Hope it helps!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Moo_MooEastMidlands
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night Barcelona break, we are independant travellers and had booked the hotel and flights online. We arrived just after midnight to find a bright, clean and inviting reception with English speaking friendly staff. The room on the third floor was well equiped with 2 beds, mini bar (that we used for our own drinks), air conditioning, safe, clock and TV. the seperate toilet and bathroom were clean, tidy and obviously regularly maintained. The room also had a balcony, though this was not furnished. Breakfast was available in the first floor restaurant, or free room service was offered by simply completing a menu card that was left in the room by the maid. The hotel is 5 blocks from the nearest metro station (Provenca) and the whole area has a feeling of calm and safety about it. In summary - a well kept easy to get to friendly hotel. Barcelona city is a great short break destination with plenty to see and do, however I was targetted 5 times by pickpockets and I can't stress enough just how vigilant you need to be.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: verudela
Reviews.Content: Do not go to this hotel!!! I booked by phone, to be sure I won’t get a little smelly room in the basement (I already experienced that in other cities..), I asked for a room at higher floor, and that is what I got - actually, the room was at fourth floor, it was small, and smelly, the window opened to a patio covered by a yellow glass three floors above – without any direct light. , bed was of poor quality. Room was also very loud, you could hear every word spoken both in corridor and in adjacent room. The window from the bathroom looked at the pipe tunnel. You need more? The description of the location as Hotel gives it is definitely misleading, it is a good half an hour walk from Catalunya Square. Choose any other hotel but this.

Reviews.Title: “5 day break”
Reviews.Author: enricostravels
Reviews.Content: The hotel is one of the nicest we have been to.The room was on the 7th floor,clean,well laid out,and quiet.The minibar was well stocked(though pricey)and cable tv -worked on every channel including english news channels except the one channel for english movies/soaps etc.But we didnt go to barcelona for the tv.The bathroom was spotless and very eco friendly in its laundry service-bravo!No tea/coffee making facilities in room but reception were more than happy to provide this service when asked.The lifts are small but do work effectively.the rooms have an outer and inner door which cuts down on any noises.We found the breakfast was limited in its hot foods eg.scrambled egg & fatty bacon only.There were many cold buffet dishes including cheeses/hams/smoked sausages/cereals/fruits/yoghurt/rolls/croissants/bread/pastries etc.which were excellent but more in keeping with warmer weather.Reception is accessed via main entrance and up a short flight of steps(wheelchair users be advised)Overall we thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and all its services/amenities.We would happily return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone not wishing to stay too close to the ramblas area(10 minute walk).There are plenty of places to eat and drink near the hotel and if on a tight budget loads of small cervezarias who sell cheap beer/tapas dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel close to local attractions”
Reviews.Author: EnglandExpects
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with good-sized, clean rooms, quiet and good staff. Well furnished throughout with a stunning spiral staircase. Great breakfast. Great location within walking distance of Las Ramblas and trains to Sitges, etc. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “On a loud main road”
Reviews.Author: CLJMG
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of Best Western hotels in Europe and this one is good but I do not believe it deserves a Premier rating. Our room was an okay size and very clean but over looked the main road below which made sleeping with the window open impossible. The bathroom was good and again very clean. This hotel is about a good twenty minute walk from from the top of the Rambles and about a ten minute walk from the nearest tourist bus stop. The area seemed very safe and there were some nice bars and restaurants around the hotel, the small Jazz bar across the road was quite but very cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Smartboy71
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, very clean throughout. Enjoyed the breakfast (I normally find breakfast disappointing in Barcelona, but not here). My room was very clean and comfortable. There was a lobby with a seperate door into the bedroom, helping to cut out corridor noise. The window looked into the central atrium and did not allow me to ascertain the outside weather. It also restricted the natural light, the room would have benefitted from improved lighting to counteract this. I chose the hotel because it was not directly in the bustling centre of town. I tend to find the more central hotels to be extremely noisy at all times of the day. For this reason, the hotel was ideal. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. The staff obviously take a lot of pride in their work.

Reviews.Title: “Dante Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am an American traveler and as you may know, we like our hotel rooms spacious. This one was right in the middle: not large enough, but not as small as most Parisian hotels have. When booking, try asking for the room not adjacent to the elevators. This rule works for ALL European hotels, not only for this one. Stuff was 50/50: some very friendly and some just there to perform basic functions. Location....If you are planning on walking a lot around Barcelona's architectural gems and shopping areas, it is a pretty good walk. For the airport transfers is quite convenient. As somebody already pointed out here, the Aerobus is a short walking distance away. But again, like in a case with me, if you have a lot of luggage, it won't work. The best part of this hotel location is Cerveseria Catalana (hope I spelled it right) is situated on the same Mallorca 3-4 blocks away towards the city center. Cheap great food and beer. Always packed with locals. Don't take a table, get situated by the bar and talk to the bartender directly, they all speak good English. It is also fun to watch them work. As a general rule, do not get breakfasts at any hotel (unless it is included in your stay). Get outside and buy better food for 3-5 Euros per person instead of 13-15 at the hotel. Enjoy your trip!

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Premier Hotel Dante
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Mallorca 181, 08036 Barcelona, Spain
